item.title: Introduction
item.description:
Version 1.0.0

The Electrum CRM Portal Interface describes a server interface against which calls can be made to retrieve information from a backend CRM system. The intended use cases include the lookup of customer-linked account or purchase history data from a bank or retailer's CRM environment. It is not intended that the CRM system is hosted by Electrum, but rather that this interface abstracts the logic required to execute a set of predefined CRM queries, hence simplifying communication. Access to the CRM system itself will be handled independently through an appropriate client implementation.

Email Electrum API

Licensed under Apache 2.0

Security Definitions

httpBasic

type basic
description All requests require HTTP basic authentication, where user name equals the value used in MessageId.institutionId and password has been agreed with Electrum.

item.title: Swagger
item.description:
The swagger (Open API) definition of the interface specification can be found here, as well as below.

Many tools are available for processing swagger files, and using a code generation tool to create a boilerplate client or server can be an excellent starting point for development. We highly recommend looking at swagger-codegen for a generator in your preferred language when starting out.

Swagger definition

    \ intended use cases include the lookup of customer-linked account or purchase\
    \ history data from a bank or retailer's CRM environment. It is not intended that\
    \ the CRM system is hosted by Electrum, but rather that this interface abstracts\
    \ the logic required to execute a set of predefined CRM queries, hence simplifying\

- "https"
